day_schedules.description: Get some quiet alone time before answering emails, phone calls, and the general demands of the day begin.
Minimize light your exposure as much as possible.
Drink the equivalent of a cup of coffee to extend your day-time drive.
Take some time to relax and plan out your day. Now would be a good time to drink something caffeinated!

day_schedules.activity: Take a break from your devices
day_schedules.description: Get away from your devices and try letting in natural light.
If you feel sleepy, take a shower to freshen up!
Eat a hearty breakfast and make sure to hydrate.
Now would be a good time to focus on whatever work you have planned.
If you feel sleepy, take a shower to freshen up.
Begin your day with a small, but hearty meal. Get going to the gym after, making sure to refuel with protein!
As you go about your day, remember to stay focused on what you need to do. Try not to relax until later in the day.
Let in light and do something that activates your brain. Could be reading the paper or playing virtual chess!
Spend time outdoors and try to increase exposure to natural light.
It's important to eat a big meal now to help your body feel recharged and to further increase your sleep drive.
Instead of driving to work, try biking or walking.
Don't take shortcuts! Go on brisk walks and interact with peers to lessen your sleep drive.
Take a brief nap if you need, but no more than 20 minutes. Now would be a good time to shower and eat a snack!

night_schedules.description: Easiest time to fall asleep. Do some work out to stay awake
Get whatever light exposure you can-avoid darkness.
Have 1-3mg melatonin for a good quality sleep.
A warm bath or meditation is always helpful.
